content.question:
Phosphofructokinase <math alttext="P F K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>PFK</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a key enzyme in glycolysis. <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is one of the two substrates for the reaction catalyzed by <math alttext="P F K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PFK</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is also an allosteric regulator of <math alttext="P F K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PFK</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Figure 1 shows the enzyme-substrate interactions of <math alttext="P F K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PFK</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Figure 1. The enzyme-substrate interactions of <math alttext="P F K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PFK</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

A researcher found a mutation that resulted in the <math alttext="P F K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PFK</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> enzyme being unable to bind <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to the allosteric site. Which of the following best predicts the effect of the mutation?

choices.label: The activity of the enzyme will not be affected because the active site is not involved in substrate binding at the allosteric site.
Negative feedback regulation does not occur, so the enzyme will be active when glycolysis is not needed.
Positive feedback does not occur, and the activity of the enzyme will decrease when glycolysis is needed.
The activity of the enzyme will fluctuate independent of the <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration.

content.answer: Negative feedback regulation does not occur, so the enzyme will be active when glycolysis is not needed.
